attributes.action: Require mental health support in schools and more funding in community services
attributes.additional_details: It is common for people to have wait times exceeding several months for beds in appropriate hospitals and years for support in the community. I waited months for a hospital to accept me and it was over 220 miles away from my home. I am very grateful for the treatment I have had and continue to receive, however, better community services and more rapid access may have prevented my need for hospitalization. There are many issues in the system I want to bring attention to and hope you recognize the need for improvement.
attributes.background: Funding for inpatient mental health services is lacking and prevention is better than cure. Early intervention is vital for reducing suicide as a leading cause of death in teenagers. If mental health support in schools improved, the number of people in hospitals would reduce.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Give the NHS more funding for mental health support: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617699

Increase funding for Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/620846

Make ‘Mental Health Studies’ a separate subject in the National Curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617834

Mandatory Mental Health Training for all educational and early years staff: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/620295

Create a statutory Mental Health & Wellbeing Policy for all schools & colleges: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611264
